items.title: Robin Guenther, Architect of Healthy Hospitals, Dies at 68
items.abstract: Supporting the use of nontoxic construction materials, she co-wrote the first guide to building green health care facilities and designed them to be less austere.

items.title: In a City of Monuments, History Lives Onstage and in the Streets
items.abstract: Three new plays at theaters in Washington explore how the past is both erased and inescapable.

items.title: The Lucrative Post-City Hall Life of an Adams Insider
items.abstract: Frank Carone, who stepped down as Mayor Eric Adams’s chief of staff in December, has found work with two commercial real estate titans, including one seeking a casino.

items.title: Carin Goldberg, 69, Who Transformed Book and Album Cover Design, Dies
items.abstract: She was in the vanguard of female designers who looked to the past to upend the cool modernism of the ’70s with a style that became prominent in the ’80s.

items.title: In the Village, Another Piece of the City’s History Is Coming Down
items.abstract: Like other vulnerable landmarks across the city, the house at 14 Gay Street — which helped inspire the musical “Wonderful Town” — is being demolished.
